COHffJ.DENTIAL COLE TELEGRAM . f . ^ i E M i D TKLEGRflH 21007. 3043 I 943 —om Political Agent in the Vr—t-r. Oul? To Foreign> New I elhii Repeated to Secretary oi’ State for India* Cairo and Muscat. Fated Bushira, 14*15 hours, 6th dnue, 1945 Received 19«00 hoursjg^ 6th June, 13- ^ i 304 . Addressed to Govt* of India# External . Affairs lept* P New Delhi, repeated to India Office, Cairo for M.E.S.C., Political Agent, Muscat. Agricultural expert (?offered) by you (? early in) 1942 was asking terms including salary Rs.2,000 per mensem. Grateful your assistance in obtaining expert from India on more reasonable terms. RECO. P 3 L KEPT. > • ■'? 4 T iliN’DIA OFFICETelegrams : (Shipping) “ 8HIPMINDBR, TELEX, LONDON •* (Inland Transport) “ TRANSHINRY, TELEX, LONDON Telephone : ABBEY 7711 Our Reference Your Reference. MINISTRY OF WAR TRANSPORT, Berkeley Square House, Sin 4 ‘ ‘t, ija Berkeley Square f id Dear Nind, London, W.l. 25th May, 1943# i Please refer to Savi n yrain No. 1 499 from regarding the appointment of an agrTcuIturaJTexpert for Muscat. You will note that the Sultan of Muscat wishes to make his territory self-supporting if possible in cereals, and has asked for an expert to advise him on the subject. The M.E.S.C. support his request but are unable to offer any suitable personnel at the moment. I We are, of course, directly interested in their 4-u/ /attempts to grow more cereals in the^Poroioft QuHf as the 'M.E.S.C. is now responsible for supplying their requirement of imported cereals, but I do not think it is primarily our duty to provide personnel for this area. It seems that any experts should be drawn from India if possible, and I hope that you will take this matter up with the Government of India and do all that you can to encourage the increased cultivation of cereals in the area. I notice that the Savingram has been repeated to the Government of India but you might consider it worthwhile to put a direct request to them for assistance. Yours sincerely, / ^ * E. D. T. «JOURDAIN. SUPPLY SECTION FOR THE MIDDLE EAST. W. W. Nind, Esq., India Office, Clarence House, Matthew Parker Street, S.W. 1.Next File: P. POLITICAL AND SECRET DEPARTMENT. 19 . P. (SP Papers may be removed from or placed within this File only by the Political Registry. 3997c 900 10.29Cover for Enclosures in Weekly Letter No. P.Z dated from Secretary, Political and Secret Department (External), India Office, to Foreign Secretary, Foreign and Political Depart ment, Government of India.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 11; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of correspondence between the Ministry of War Transport, the India Office and the Government of India, External Affairs Department regarding the request and appointment of an expert for Muscat in order to assist in making the territory self-supporting in the production of cereal.
